li.a: Online Learning Resources During COVID-19 Closure

TSD Knoxville ASL Storytelling with Dack Virnig

section.aria-label: Tennessee Schools for the Deaf Video

video.alt: Film of WTSD, TSDN, and TSDK

div.div: In accordance with the Governor's recommendation on April 15, 2020, Tennessee Schools for the Deaf at all three campuses (Knoxville, Nashville, and WTSD Jackson) are closed through the end of the current 2019-2020 school year due to the outbreak of the COVID-19 virus. Teachers and staff directly related to students are making contact with students and families. TSD staff in most supporting roles are working remotely and answering e-mail.
See the Superintendent's Letters and Updates on our website for specific school related information.

h3.a: TSD Schools (all campuses) will remain closed through the end of the current school year.

div.div: In accordance with Governor Lee's recommendation for all Tennessee schools on Wednesday, April 15th, Tennessee Schools for the Deaf (all campuses) will remain closed through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. The Superintendent's Letter to TSD Parents/Families is available on the COVID-19 webpage.

Due to the uncertainty of the situation with the COVID-19 outbreak as a precautionary measure, TSD has made the difficult decision to cancel this year’s Summer Camp. We look forward to being together for next year’s Summer Camp!

h3.a: Letter from the Director of Instruction, Lisa Collins, to Parents and Guardians

div.div: Letter regarding school updates from the Director of Instruction, Lisa Collins, to parents and guardians.

Tennessee Schools for the Deaf, all campuses, will be closed through April 24, 2020. TSD Knoxville residential students will return to campus on Sunday April 26th and classes will resume for all campuses on Monday, April 27th. For more detailed information including online learning for students, review the TSD COVID-19 Superintendent's Letters and Updates.
